intro: Dilkea clarkei, commonly known as Clarke's dilkea, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of arid ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
